newsitem.title: GERMANY: RWE forecasts higher earnings in 1996/97.
newsitem.headline: RWE forecasts higher earnings in 1996/97.

text.p: German diversified utility group RWE AG said on Tuesday that it was confident it will report higher profits in the business year to the end of June 1996/97 for the eighth year in a row.

"We are confident that we can again increase earnings in 1996/97 following measures we have taken," said Dietmar Kuhnt, management board chairman of RWE AG in a statement to be presented at the group's interim news conference.
Kuhnt said that its proposed 10 pfennig increase to 1.50 marks in dividends was further evidence of its stated aim of boosting earnings.
"We are convinced that the strategic direction of the group shows signs of long-term continuity," said Kuhnt.
RWE AG reported a 10 percent increase in group net profits, excluding minority interests, to 1.2 billion marks in the year to the end of June 1996.
